greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of Wroblewski's constant arising in nonaveraging sequences.
comment: A nonaveraging sequence contains no three terms which are in an arithmetic progression. Wroblewski (1984) showed that for infinite nonaveraging sequences Sup_{all nonaveraging sequences b(n)} Sum_{k>=1} 1/b(k) > 3.00849. [Typo corrected by _Stefan Steinerberger_, Aug 28 2008]
reference: S. R. Finch, "Erdos' Reciprocal Sum Constants." 2.20 in Mathematical Constants. Cambridge, England: Cambridge University Press, pp. 163-166, 2003.
R. K. Guy, "Nonaveraging Sets. Nondividing Sets." C16 in Unsolved Problems in Number Theory, 2nd ed. New York: Springer-Verlag, pp. 131-132, 1994.
link: J. Wroblewski, A Nonaveraging Set of Integers with a Large Sum of Reciprocals, Math. Comput. 43, 261-262, 1984.
formula: Decimal expansion of Sup_{all nonaveraging sequences b(n)} Sum_{k>=1} b(k).
results.author: _Jonathan Vos Post_, Jul 05 2008
